intro: Godetia quadrivulnera var. hallii, commonly known as the Hall's godetia, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from pink to purple. The plant typically grows as an annual herb with hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, often found in disturbed habitats such as roadsides and fields. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for gardens and floral arrangements.
